info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 7:08AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Narrow band of heavy rain, pea size hail, and strong windshift will impact portions of New London, central New Haven, Middlesex, Suffolk and southeastern Nassau Counties through 830 AM EST... At 704 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a north to south oriented narrow band of heavy rain, pea size hail, and a strong windshift near from Hartford to near Northport to Farmingdale. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Westerly wind gusts of 50 to 60 mph and pea size hail. Isolated 65 mph possible along the coast. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Islip, Jewett City, New Haven, Meriden, Brentwood, Milford, Middletown, Wallingford, Norwich, Commack, Riverhead, Huntington Station, Centereach, Shirley and Deer Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this line and may lead to minor localized flooding.
